intro: Tetradoxa omeiensis, commonly known as the Omei Mountain tetradoxa, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive four-lobed calyx and showy violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with high humidity and cool temperatures. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
